complete.body: You’re helping contain the spread of the virus and protect others in your community and beyond.

escrow_verification.person_and_health_expert: A person talking to a health expert

start.body:
If you have tested positive for COVID-19 (not through an antibody test), you can anonymously report the test.

Reporting your test will help others in your community contain the spread of the virus.

user_details_form.subheader: Please provide your phone number and test date and we'll text you your verification code.

export.complete_body_bluetooth: You’re helping contain the spread of the virus and protect others in your community.
export.complete_title: Thanks for keeping your community safe!
export.consent_body_0: Sharing your positive diagnosis is optional and can only be done with your consent.
export.consent_body_2: The only information shared will be the random set of numbers your phone exchanged over Bluetooth with other phones that were nearby during the past 14 days, along with a weighted risk score based on when your symptoms developed.
export.consent_warning_message: Continuing will void your verification code. If you would like to share your positive diagnosis in the future, you will first need to get a new verification code.
export.enable_exposure_notifications_body: You must enable exposure notifications to report a positive test result.

error.invalid_format: Codes may only contain numbers and letters
error.verification_code_used: Verification code has already been used

intro.body1: If you have received a verification code from {{healthAuthorityName}} for a positive COVID-19 test, you can submit the verification code on the following screen.
intro.body2: If you do not have a code, but you do have a positive test, you will need to get a verification code from {{healthAuthorityName}} before continuing.
intro.header: Do you have your verification code?

export.person_and_health_expert: A person talking to a health expert

errors.description: The operation could not be completed. {{message}}
errors.internal_server_error: The server is experiencing problems, please try again later
errors.timeout: The request took too long to complete
errors.unknown: Failed to submit the exposure data

no_op.empty_exposure_keys: It looks like you have no encounter logs on your device, please wait 24 hours to proceed if you recently reset your data. You may need to request a new verification code.
no_op.empty_exposure_keys_title: No encounter logging data is available
no_op.no_token_for_existing_keys: Existing data was sent to the server. This usually means that this process was attempted previously from this device, but on a different application. You can communicate this to the authority that provided the verification code that was used. There were {{newKeysInserted}} new keys added.

symptom_onset.no_i_didnt_have: No, I didn't have any symptoms

verification_code_info.contact_at: You may also call the {{healthAuthorityName}} at
verification_code_info.how_do_i_get_header: How do I get a verification code?
verification_code_info.info_body:
A verification code is a code provided to you by your health authority, {{healthAuthorityName}}, if you receive a positive test result.

The verification code is used to verify that your positive test result is authentic.

Each verification code will expire after a short period to ensure that out of date test results are not submitted.

If you encounter an error when submitting your verification code, you must get a new code from your health authority before submitting again.
verification_code_info.what_happens_body:
When you submit your verification code, you will be asked to confirm the app can anonymously share with others that they may have been exposed.

If you give permission, your device will send random exposure codes out to anonymously alert others that they were near someone who tested positive for COVID-19. This allows exposed individuals to act more quickly to find a testing center and also protect those around them.
verification_code_info.what_happens_header: What happens when I submit my code?

exposure_detail.schedule_callback: Schedule a call with the {{healthAuthorityName}} to get help to successfully quarantine.

exposure_history.exposure_summary: Someone you were near between {{startDate}} and {{endDate}} tested positive for COVID-19.
exposure_history.how_does_this_work_para: When Exposure Notifications are on, your phone uses Bluetooth Low Energy to swap and save random number strings (called random IDs) from any phones it is in close contact to that also have Exposure Notifications enabled. Random IDs won’t identify you personally to other users and change many times a day to protect your privacy.
exposure_history.no_connectivity_message: You are not connected to the internet!
exposure_history.no_exposure_reports_over_past: You haven't received any exposure reports over the past 14-days
exposure_history.why_did_i_get_an_en: Why did I get an exposure notification?
exposure_history.why_did_i_get_an_en_para: You will receive an exposure notification when someone you have been in close contact with later uses the app to report a positive COVID-19 test.
exposure_history.your_device_exchanged: Within each date range below, your device exchanged keys with another device that later received a verified positive test result.
exposure_history.your_recommended_quarantine_is_over: Your recommended quarantine is over. Please continue to follow the health guidelines.

exposure_notification_alerts.bluetooth_body: To activate Exposure Notifications, you must first turn on Bluetooth in your Settings app.
exposure_notification_alerts.cant_check_for_exposures_body: You must enable Exposure Notifications to check for exposures.
exposure_notification_alerts.location_body: Google requires that devices running Android 10 or below have location services enabled to use Exposure Notifications. {{applicationName}} does NOT track or keep a record of your location.
exposure_notification_alerts.set_active_region_ios_body: Open the Settings app, navigate to the Exposure Notifications settings for this app, then press 'Set As Active Region'.
exposure_notification_alerts.share_exposure_information_ios_body: Open the Settings app, then navigate to the Exposure Notifications settings for this app. Ensure 'Share Exposure Information' is turned on, then press 'Set As Active Region'.
exposure_notification_alerts.unhandled_error_body: Something unexpected happened. Please close and reopen the app and try again.
exposure_notification_alerts.use_exposure_notifications_android_body: To enable Exposure Notifications, go to the COVID-19 Exposure Notifications screen of your Settings app and enable 'Use Exposure Notifications'.

exposure_scanning_status.your_device_is_not: Your device is not scanning for exposures. Fix the issues below to enable Exposure Detection.
exposure_scanning_status.your_device_is_scanning: Your device is scanning for exposures and will continue to do so even if you close the app.

home.bluetooth_info_body: Your phone detects other phones you spend time in close contact with using Bluetooth Low Energy. This allows the app to log your daily encounters anonymously, even when you don’t have the app open on your device.

bluetooth.all_services_on_subheader: {{applicationName}} will remain active after the app has been closed
bluetooth.location_disabled_error_message: To activate the Exposure Notification technology, authorize Location access in the Settings app
bluetooth.location_subheader: {{applicationName}} never accesses your location data and your device is never tracked.
bluetooth.share_message: Check out this app {{applicationName}}, which can help us contain COVID-19! {{appDownloadUrl}}
bluetooth.tracing_off_subheader: Enable Bluetooth and Proximity Tracing to get info about possible exposures

home.check_if_your_symptoms: Enter your symptoms and get an instant recommendation on how to stay safe.
home.could_not_open_link: Could not open link: {{url}}. Please try to open the url in your phone's browser.

error.share_link_failed: Failed to open link to share

home.location_info_body: Google requires that devices running Android 10 or below have location services enabled to use Exposure Detection. {{applicationName}} does NOT track or keep a record of your location.
home.location_info_subheader: {{applicationName}} does not track or keep a record of your location
home.notifications_off: Turn on notifications to get notified if you receive an exposure
home.proximity_tracing_info_body_1: If smartphones with the app installed are turned on, have Bluetooth enabled, and are near each other for a period of time, an anonymous encounter is registered on your device.
home.proximity_tracing_info_body_2: In the event of an encounter, your data, and information remain anonymous. The app doesn’t store any personal data. Only random IDs are exchanged. These are deleted within 14 days.

verification_code_card.if_you_have_a_code: Submit your verification code to help keep your community safe.
verification_code_card.if_you_have_a_positive_test: If you have tested positive for COVID-19, you can anonymously report the test to help keep your community safe.

onboarding.app_setup_complete_body: {{applicationName}} is active. Thank you for helping break the chain of infection.
onboarding.app_setup_incomplete_body: {{applicationName}} requires Exposure Notifications and Bluetooth permissions to know when you have been exposed to COVID-19. You can authorize this in Settings.
onboarding.app_setup_incomplete_location_body: {{applicationName}} requires Exposure Notifications, Bluetooth, and Location permissions to know when you have been exposed to COVID-19. You can authorize this in Settings.
onboarding.eula_agree_terms_of_use: I agree that I have read and accepted the terms of use
onboarding.location_alert_body: To use Exposure Notifications, Location Services must be enabled
onboarding.location_body: Google requires that devices running Android 10 or below have location services enabled to use Bluetooth scanning for Exposure Detection. However, {{applicationName}} does NOT track or keep a record of your location.
onboarding.location_subheader: {{applicationName}} never accesses your location data and your device is never tracked.
onboarding.notification_body1: You’ll receive notifications when you may have crossed paths with someone who has reported positive for COVID-19.
onboarding.notification_body2: The app does this using Bluetooth Low Energy and secure random codes without knowing who you are or where you’ve been. You can turn this off at any time in settings.
onboarding.notification_header: Get notified if you may have been exposed
onboarding.notification_subheader3: This app does not protect you from COVID-19 infection.

protect_privacy.body_1: These IDs do not contain any personal information and change every 10-20 minutes to protect your identity.
protect_privacy.body_2: Phones swap random IDs with other devices using Bluetooth Low Energy. This allows {{applicationName}} to keep track of your daily encounters anonymously, even when you don’t have it open on your device.
protect_privacy.body_3: After testing positive for COVID-19, users can share a verification code with {{applicationName}} to verify their diagnosis. Their phone’s recent random IDs are flagged and securely uploaded to the server. This verification process helps prevent false positive reports.
protect_privacy.body_4: If a flagged ID matches with an ID stored on your phone, this indicates you may have encountered someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. This is how {{applicationName}} can determine if you may have been exposed to the virus.
protect_privacy.body_5:
If there’s a match, {{applicationName}} will notify you and provide further guidance from your health department.

This is how {{applicationName}} can empower you to make decisions about your health, and keep your community safe, all without knowing who you are or where you’ve been.
protect_privacy.subheader_1: When you turn on Exposure Notifications, your phone is tagged with frequently-changing, random IDs
protect_privacy.subheader_2: Phones with Exposure Notifications enabled swap IDs with other devices they encounter
protect_privacy.subheader_3: When a user tests positive, they can choose to anonymously share their health status
protect_privacy.subheader_4: Each phone periodically communicates with the server for the list of flagged IDs and looks for matches
protect_privacy.subheader_5: You will be notified if {{applicationName}} finds a positive match with a flagged ID

onboarding.proximity_tracing_body1: If smartphones with the app installed are turned on, have bluetooth enabled, and are near each other for a period of time, an encounter is registered on your device.
onboarding.proximity_tracing_body2: In the event of an encounter, your data, and information remain anonymous. The app doesn’t store any personal data. Only random IDs are exchanged. These are deleted after 14 days.
onboarding.proximity_tracing_subheader3: This app does not protect you from COVID-19 infection.
onboarding.screen1_header: Together, we can slow the spread of COVID-19.
onboarding.screen1_image_label: Two people high fiving each other
onboarding.screen2_header: Your phone remembers other devices it meets, but it won’t identify you to anyone.
onboarding.screen3_header: Your personally identifiable information never leaves your phone.
onboarding.screen3_image_label: A person in front of a locked phone
onboarding.screen4_header: The app will notify you if you may have been exposed to COVID-19
onboarding.screen4_image_label: A person getting a notification on their phone
onboarding.welcome_image_label: An illustration of people with masks on, connected like nodes in a network.
onboarding.you_must_be: You must be {{minimumAge}} or older to use {{applicationName}}. Are you over {{minimumAge}}?

product_analytics.share_anonymized_data_disclaimer: By proceeding, you agree to share anonymized event data with the {{healthAuthorityName}}
product_analytics.share_data_para_1: Anonymous and aggregated data about how communities are using this app helps the {{healthAuthorityName}} analyze, understand, and contain the spread of COVID-19.
product_analytics.share_data_para_2: The data contains no personally-identifying information.

call_emergency_services.urgent_medical_attention_needed: Urgent medical attention may be needed. Please call {{emergencyPhoneNumber}} or go to the Emergency Department

emergency_symptoms.are_you_experiencing: Are you experiencing any of these emergency symptoms?
emergency_symptoms.chest_pain: Severe, constant chest pain or pressure

general_symptoms.are_you_experiencing: Are you experiencing any of these symptoms?
general_symptoms.loss_of_smell_taste_appetite: Sustained loss of smell, taste, or appetite

guidance.call_your_healthcare_provider: Call your healthcare provider, clinician advice line, or telemedicine provider within 24 hours.
guidance.dont_go_to_work: Do not go to work, school, or public areas.
guidance.dont_use_public_transport: Do not use public transportation or ride sharing.
guidance.drink_water: Drink plenty of water and other clear liquids to prevent fluid loss (dehydration).
guidance.feeling_fine: Good to hear you’re feeling fine. You should monitor your symptoms and stay at home.
guidance.follow_cdc_guidance: If you develop symptoms, follow CDC guidance.
guidance.if_symptoms_develop: If you develop any COVID-19 symptoms or if you start to feel worse, call your healthcare provider, clinician advice line, or telemedicine provider.
guidance.may_help_you_feel_better: Here are some steps that may help you feel better:
guidance.monitor_your_symptoms: Sorry you’re feeling ill. Stay at home and monitor your symptoms. Call your provider if you get worse symptoms, stay at home.
guidance.protect_others: Take these steps to help protect others from getting sick.
guidance.seek_medical_care: If you think it is an emergency or you feel worse, seek medical care.
guidance.stay_6_feet_away: Stay at least 6 feet away from others and stay out of crowded places.
guidance.stay_at_home: Stay at home except to get medical care.
guidance.stay_away_from_higher_risk_people: If possible, stay away from people who are at higher risk for getting very sick from COVID-19.
guidance.take_care_of_yourself: Learn how to take care of yourself or someone else who is sick.
guidance.take_temperature: Take your temperature twice a day and watch for symptoms of COVID-19.
guidance.you_have_underlying_conditions: Sorry you’re not feeling well. Your symptoms may be related to COVID-19. You also have medical conditions that may put you at risk of becoming more seriously ill.
guidance.your_symptoms_might_be_related: Sorry you’re not feeling well. Your symptoms may be related to COVID-19.

intro.find_out_how_to_care: Find out how to care for yourself and others after close contact with someone positive for COVID-19
intro.if_this_is: If this is an emergency, please call {{emergencyPhoneNumber}}
intro.learn_more: Learn more about the CDC Coronavirus Self-Checker this Self Assessment is based on
intro.this_is_based_on: This is based on the latest guidance from the CDC and may be updated over time as we learn more about how the virus spreads and the illness it causes
intro.this_is_not_intended: This is not intended for diagnosis or treatment
intro.you_are_a_resident: You are a resident of the community supported by {{ healthAuthorityName }}

underlying_conditions.blood_disorder: Blood disorder, such as sickle cell disease or thalassemia
underlying_conditions.cerebrovascular_disease: Cerebrovascular disease or neurological condition, such as stroke or dementia
underlying_conditions.do_you_have: Do you have any of the following conditions?
underlying_conditions.heart_condition: Serious heart condition, such as heart failure, coronary artery disease, or cardiomyopathy
underlying_conditions.lung_disease: Chronic lung disease, such as moderate to severe asthma, COPD, cystic fibrosis, or pulmonary fibrosis
underlying_conditions.weakened_immune_system: Weakened immune system or taking medications that may cause immune suppression

settings.delete_data_disclosure1: When you press "Delete My Data", all data stored by {{applicationName}} will be deleted:
settings.delete_data_disclosure2:
This does not delete the data created or collected by your device for Exposure Notifications.

You can delete this additional data in your device Settings.
settings.delete_data_language_token: A token stored on your device that saves your language preference
settings.delete_data_onboarding_token: A token stored on your device that saves whether you have completed the app onboarding
settings.delete_data_product_analytics: A token stored on your device that saves whether you have consented to sharing product analytics data
settings.delete_data_symptom_history: Any symptom logs stored on your device
settings.delete_data_this_action: This action will delete all data stored by {{applicationName}}.

errors.deleting_data: Sorry, we could not delete your data

errors.updating_symptoms: Sorry, we could not update your symptoms

sharing.you_did_not_feel_well: You did not feel well, symptoms included: {{symptomList}}

symptom_history.to_protect_your_privacy: To protect your privacy, entries are stored on your device and deleted automatically after {{days}} days.

symptom.inability_to_wake_or_stay_awake: Inability to wake or stay awake
symptom.new_loss_of_taste_or_smell: New loss of taste or smell
symptom.persistent_pain_or_pressure_in_the_chest: Persistent pain or pressure in the chest
symptom.shortness_of_breath_or_difficulty_breath: Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing

verification_code_alerts.code_used_body: The verification code provided has already been used.
verification_code_alerts.invalid_code_body:
The verification code you submitted is invalid.

The code must be a valid verification code provided to you by your health authority.

It is also possible that your code has expired. If so, you will need to request a new code from your health authority.
verification_code_alerts.network_connection_body: You need to be connected to WiFi to submit a verification code.
verification_code_alerts.no_keys_on_device_body: You do not have any exposures to submit. Please continue to isolate.
verification_code_alerts.unknown_body: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.
